Job Title: Roofing Products Scientist

Location: Chandler, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job#: 2021903

Job Description:

 Roofing Products Scientist 

The Roofing Product Scientist is the responsible for product development, formulations, specification development, performance/improvement studies, manufacturing process and technical support for our modified asphalt products, roofing, waterproofing and other industrial uses. The Roofing Product Scientist must have leadership and presentation skills and an extensive understanding of applicable specifications; required product performance characteristics; asphalt, polymer, and modifier raw materials; experimental methods and have sufficient computer and communications skills.

 Specific Duties: 

 Communicate and interact with customers and sales personnel to determine needed characteristics of desired products  Take the lead on projects and supervise and lead on projects  Identify appropriate raw materials needed to achieve desired characteristics  Design and oversee studies/verification evaluations to be performed inhouse or by outside sources to develop product formulations  Develop manufacturing instructions and procedures at production plants  Develop quality control procedures for raw materials and finished products for production plants  Put forth new and innovative product types that could be offered by the company  Oversee/evaluate raw materials and finished product quality results to determine if adjustments in formulations or processes are needed  Maintain up to date formulations and manufacturing instructions for assigned products at plants for assigned products  Maintain needed customer or outside agency / organization approvals needed for assigned products  Optimize formulations considering specification conformance and production quality results  Provide answers to customer questions and recommendations on product specifications, properties, performance, use, applicability, etc.  Understand competitive product characteristics and performance 

 Qualifications include: 

 BS degree in an appropriate engineering or other scientific field. MS and PhD candidates are also welcome to apply.  Minimum of 3 years related work experience in asphalt products and product development  Working knowledge of email, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and MRP program systems  Up to 25% travel when needed (domestic to other plants and customers)  Ability to lift 50 lbs on occasion  Relocation assistance is offered 

This position offers a competitive salary with an excellent benefits package including: Profit Sharing, Matching 401(k), Health, Life, Dental, Short & Long Term Disability, Holiday, Personal, and Sick paid leave, Maternity Leave, and Tuition Assistance.
